data.message: Implement separate static & dynamic OSC->ROS behaviour. Separate the code into multiple files to keep things manageable

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Document the OSC address -> ROS topic sanitization process

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Add a function to sanitize the generated OSC address -> ROS topic; ROS is more restrictive than OSC

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Change the types in the raw OscMessage to an array. Fill in the raw message types & payload before publishing. Add a 1s timeout to the UDP socket to lower CPU usage. Add additional logging to the UDP socket processing

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Fill in the rest of the OSC -> ROS code. Ready for testing?

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Start filling in the OSC -> ROS part of the bridge

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Add building instructions

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Add a metapackage

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Add osc_type to disambiguate where multiple ROS types are re-used. Implement a subscription wrapper that handles the outgoing UDP socket for us.

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Fix the name of the executable in the launch file, ignore `--ros-args -r ...` arguments passed automatically by the launch file

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Start filling in the body of the bridge node & launch file. Add a basic example configuration as the default. Add the resource directory

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Remove unnecessary dependency on std_msgs, rename NULL to NIL to prevent clobbering the C++ keyword

data.author: Chris I-B
data.message: Initial commit. Still lots of work to do
